title: So
body:
What would the population of the OCE Servers have to be in order to play Twisted Treeline (Ranked)
Seriously
I really do want to play TT on Ranked :3

replies.body:
Riot doesn't release any data on the total players for any servers, but we do have access to ranked totals, which are a decent indication of server population.

**LAN** and **LAS** both recently got Twisted Treeline queues. See that [here](http://lan.leagueoflegends.com/es/news/game-updates/features/el-3v3-regresa-para-quedarse).

They had around 350,000 ranked players when their queue was added. **OCE** and **RU**, who both don't have Twisted Treeline, were at around 160,000 or less ranked players.

If we assume the percentage of ranked players stays roughly the same with server growth, we would need to almost double our current player base to be able to have Twisted Treeline.

_Note: All stats taken from [here](http://www.lolsummoners.com/stats/oce). Also keep in mind that these stats are 9 months out of date, which happens to be convenient because **LAN** and **LAS** got their servers about 12 months ago._
If you don't mind me asking, how come your name is green?

No problem! :D

I'm an emissary on the forums, which means I essentially answer smaller questions that Riot doesn't have much time for. But I also have some connections to Riot to get their advice on bigger issues and questions.

You can read more about this [here](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behaviour/Edu7E6Bp-introducing-the-emissaries).

> If we assume the percentage of ranked players stays roughly the same with server growth, we would need to almost double our current player base to be able to have Twisted Treeline.

> _Note: All stats taken from [here](http://www.lolsummoners.com/stats/oce). Also keep in mind that these stats are 9 months out of date, which happens to be convenient because **LAN** and **LAS** got their servers about 12 months ago._
